bug.author: ajinkya933
bug.summary: Error in make file in 'develop' branch
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I want to install developer version of streamlit (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing>https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing</denchmark-link> ) I am getting following error during <denchmark-code>ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Music/streamlit$ make all-devel Makefile:281: extraneous text after 'endif' directive pip install pip-tools pipenv ; \ if [[ 2.7.12 == "3.6.0" || 2.7.12 > "3.6.0" ]] ; then \ pip install black ; \ fi /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/_vendor/requests/__init__.py:83: RequestsDependencyWarning: Old version of cryptography ([1, 2, 3]) may cause slowdown. warnings.warn(warning, RequestsDependencyWarning) DEPRECATION: Python 2.7 will reach the end of its life on January 1st, 2020. Please upgrade your Python as Python 2.7 won't be maintained after that date. A future version of pip will drop support for Python 2.7. More details about Python 2 support in pip, can be found at https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/development/release-process/#python-2-support Requirement already satisfied: pip-tools in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (4.2.0) Requirement already satisfied: pipenv in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (2018.11.26) Requirement already satisfied: six in /home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python2.7/site-packages (from pip-tools) (1.12.0) Requirement already satisfied: click>=6 in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pip-tools) (7.0) Requirement already satisfied: enum34; python_version < "3" in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (1.1.6) Requirement already satisfied: certifi in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (2019.9.11) Requirement already satisfied: typing; python_version < "3.5" in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (3.7.4) Requirement already satisfied: virtualenv in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (16.4.3) Requirement already satisfied: setuptools>=36.2.1 in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (41.6.0) Requirement already satisfied: virtualenv-clone>=0.2.5 in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (0.5.3) Requirement already satisfied: pip>=9.0.1 in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages (from pipenv) (19.3.1) /bin/sh: 2: [[: not found /bin/sh: 2: 2.7.12: not found cd lib; pipenv install --dev Pipfile.lock not found, creating‚Ä¶ Locking [dev-packages] dependencies‚Ä¶ ‚úò Locking Failed! Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 126, in <module> main() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 119, in main parsed.requirements_dir, parsed.packages) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 85, in _main requirements_dir=requirements_dir, File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 69, in resolve req_dir=requirements_dir File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/utils.py", line 726, in resolve_deps req_dir=req_dir, File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/utils.py", line 480, in actually_resolve_deps resolved_tree = resolver.resolve() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/utils.py", line 385, in resolve results = self.resolver.resolve(max_rounds=environments.PIPENV_MAX_ROUNDS) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/resolver.py", line 102, in resolve has_changed, best_matches = self._resolve_one_round() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/resolver.py", line 206, in _resolve_one_round for dep in self._iter_dependencies(best_match): File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/resolver.py", line 301, in _iter_dependencies dependencies = self.repository.get_dependencies(ireq) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 234, in get_dependencies legacy_results = self.get_legacy_dependencies(ireq) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 426, in get_legacy_dependencies results, ireq = self.resolve_reqs(download_dir, ireq, wheel_cache) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 297, in resolve_reqs results = resolver._resolve_one(reqset, ireq) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/resolve.py", line 260, in _resolve_one abstract_dist = self._get_abstract_dist_for(req_to_install) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/resolve.py", line 213, in _get_abstract_dist_for self.require_hashes File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/operations/prepare.py", line 294, in prepare_linked_requirement abstract_dist.prep_for_dist(finder, self.build_isolation) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/operations/prepare.py", line 127, in prep_for_dist self.req.run_egg_info() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/req/req_install.py", line 474, in run_egg_info command_desc='python setup.py egg_info') File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/utils/misc.py", line 705, in call_subprocess % (command_desc, proc.returncode, cwd)) pipenv.patched.notpip._internal.exceptions.InstallationError: Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/tmpdoy_wcs_build/functools32/ File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 126, in <module> main() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 119, in main parsed.requirements_dir, parsed.packages) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 85, in _main requirements_dir=requirements_dir, File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/resolver.py", line 69, in resolve req_dir=requirements_dir File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/utils.py", line 726, in resolve_deps req_dir=req_dir, File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/utils.py", line 480, in actually_resolve_deps resolved_tree = resolver.resolve() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/utils.py", line 385, in resolve results = self.resolver.resolve(max_rounds=environments.PIPENV_MAX_ROUNDS) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/resolver.py", line 102, in resolve has_changed, best_matches = self._resolve_one_round() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/resolver.py", line 206, in _resolve_one_round for dep in self._iter_dependencies(best_match): File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/resolver.py", line 301, in _iter_dependencies dependencies = self.repository.get_dependencies(ireq) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 234, in get_dependencies legacy_results = self.get_legacy_dependencies(ireq) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 426, in get_legacy_dependencies results, ireq = self.resolve_reqs(download_dir, ireq, wheel_cache) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/piptools/repositories/pypi.py", line 297, in resolve_reqs results = resolver._resolve_one(reqset, ireq) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/resolve.py", line 260, in _resolve_one abstract_dist = self._get_abstract_dist_for(req_to_install) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/resolve.py", line 213, in _get_abstract_dist_for self.require_hashes File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/operations/prepare.py", line 294, in prepare_linked_requirement abstract_dist.prep_for_dist(finder, self.build_isolation) File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/operations/prepare.py", line 127, in prep_for_dist self.req.run_egg_info() File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/req/req_install.py", line 474, in run_egg_info command_desc='python setup.py egg_info') File "/home/ajinkya/.local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pipenv/patched/notpip/_internal/utils/misc.py", line 705, in call_subprocess % (command_desc, proc.returncode, cwd)) pipenv.patched.notpip._internal.exceptions.InstallationError: Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/tmpdoy_wcs_build/functools32/ Makefile:42: recipe for target 'pipenv-install' failed make: *** [pipenv-install] Error 1
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Ubuntu 16: <denchmark-code># Set up the Yarn repo $ curl -sS https://dl.yarnpkg.com/debian/pubkey.gpg | sudo apt-key add - $ echo "deb https://dl.yarnpkg.com/debian/ stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/yarn.list
$ sudo apt-get update
# Install Pyenv for testing multiple Python versions $ sudo apt install -y make build-essential libssl-dev zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev \ libreadline-dev libsqlite3-dev wget curl llvm libncurses5-dev libncursesw5-dev \ xz-utils tk-dev libffi-dev liblzma-dev python-openssl git $ curl -L https://github.com/pyenv/pyenv-installer/raw/master/bin/pyenv-installer | bash
# Install some other deps $ sudo apt install graphviz python3-distutils
# Install Yarn, PIP, the ProtoBuf compiler $ sudo apt install yarn python-pip protobuf-compiler libgconf-2-4 # (libgconf is for our e2e tests in Cypress)
$ pip install pipenv </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>$ git clone https://github.com/ajinkya933/streamlit.git $ cd streamlit $ git remote add remote https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit.git $ git checkout develop $ git checkout -b issue120/file-uploader </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Music/streamlit$ cd lib ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Music/streamlit/lib$ pipenv --three Virtualenv already exists! Removing existing virtualenv‚Ä¶ Creating a virtualenv for this project‚Ä¶ Pipfile: /home/ajinkya/Music/streamlit/lib/Pipfile Using /usr/bin/python3.6m (3.6.9) to create virtualenv‚Ä¶ ‚†ã Creating virtual environment...Using base prefix '/usr' New python executable in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-djaVwj9b/bin/python3.6m Also creating executable in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-djaVwj9b/bin/python Installing setuptools, pip, wheel... done. Running virtualenv with interpreter /usr/bin/python3.6m
‚úî Successfully created virtual environment! Virtualenv location: /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-djaVwj9b
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>$ make all-devel </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
should install developer vesion of streamlit <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
'pipenv-install' failed <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) : 0.48.1 Python version: (get it with $ python --version) : 3.6 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex?: PipEnv OS version: ubuntu 16 Browser version: firefox

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajinkya933>@ajinkya933</denchmark-link>
Did you run make all-devel within the python shell? using pipenv shell after installing it ?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/arraydude>@arraydude</denchmark-link> yes I did. I get the same error
Fix on error <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/665>#665</denchmark-link>

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/903124>@903124</denchmark-link> for it! <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajinkya933>@ajinkya933</denchmark-link> could you get it working with the solution linked in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/665>#665</denchmark-link> ?
No, the above method requires me to get a paid subscription. So I am not going that route.
I mean you should follow the issue and comment out tensorflow in pipefile so pipenv-install will not fail. You can compile it on your computer with using a paid subscription
Working example: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13618001/70497630-b9fd3680-1b4e-11ea-935a-7b823dd0acfa.png></denchmark-link>

I mean you should follow the issue and comment out tensorflow in pipefile so pipenv-install will not fail. You can compile it on your computer with using a paid subscription
Is it doable without getting a paid subscription ? I donot have any free credits of azure left

I mean you should follow the issue and comment out tensorflow in pipefile so pipenv-install will not fail. You can compile it on your computer with using a paid subscription
Is it doable without getting a paid subscription ?
Yes
Okay, Ill give it a shot and get back, thanks for letting me know

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/903124>@903124</denchmark-link> is there another way without using azure apparently I need to register my credit card to avail vscode online services, which I dont want to do. Can this be done using docker on windows insted of VS online

@903124 is there another way without using azure apparently I need to register my credit card to avail vscode online services, which I dont want to do. Can this be done using docker on windows insted of VS online
There is absolutely no need to use Azere or anything, just edit the pipefile. You can use Ubuntu on Windows WSL if not using docker

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/903124>@903124</denchmark-link> I followed your steps and was able to get few steps forward. Lake a look: <denchmark-code>(lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit$ make all-devel Makefile:281: extraneous text after 'endif' directive pip install pip-tools pipenv ; \ if [[ 3.6.9 == "3.6.0" || 3.6.9 > "3.6.0" ]] ; then \ pip install black ; \ fi Requirement already satisfied: pip-tools in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (4.3.0) Requirement already satisfied: pipenv in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (2018.11.26) Requirement already satisfied: click>=6 in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pip-tools) (7.0) Requirement already satisfied: six in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pip-tools) (1.13.0) Requirement already satisfied: pip>=9.0.1 in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pipenv) (19.3.1) Requirement already satisfied: virtualenv-clone>=0.2.5 in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pipenv) (0.5.3) Requirement already satisfied: virtualenv in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pipenv) (16.7.8) Requirement already satisfied: certifi in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pipenv) (2019.11.28) Requirement already satisfied: setuptools>=36.2.1 in /home/ajinkya/.local/share/virtualenvs/lib-SytFLcJe/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pipenv) (42.0.2) /bin/sh: 2: [[: not found /bin/sh: 2: 3.6.9: not found cd lib; pipenv install --dev Pipfile.lock not found, creating‚Ä¶ Locking [dev-packages] dependencies‚Ä¶ ‚úî Success! Locking [packages] dependencies‚Ä¶ ‚úî Success! Updated Pipfile.lock (bd99f1)! Installing dependencies from Pipfile.lock (bd99f1)‚Ä¶ Ignoring funcsigs: markers 'python_version < "3.0"' don't match your environment üêç ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ‚ñâ 96/96 ‚Äî 00:00:24 cd frontend/ ; yarn install --frozen-lockfile /usr/share/yarn/lib/cli.js:46099 let { ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token { at exports.runInThisContext (vm.js:53:16) at Module._compile (module.js:374:25) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:417:10) at Module.load (module.js:344:32) at Function.Module._load (module.js:301:12) at Module.require (module.js:354:17) at require (internal/module.js:12:17) at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/yarn/bin/yarn.js:24:13) at Module._compile (module.js:410:26) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:417:10) Makefile:237: recipe for target 'react-init' failed make: *** [react-init] Error 1
</denchmark-code>
However when I run streamlit hello i get ImportError: cannot import name Balloons_pb2 The detailed log is as follows: <denchmark-code>(lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit$ streamlit hello /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/__init__.py:83: RequestsDependencyWarning: Old version of cryptography ([1, 2, 3]) may cause slowdown. warnings.warn(warning, RequestsDependencyWarning) Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/bin/streamlit", line 11, in <module> load_entry_point('streamlit', 'console_scripts', 'streamlit')() File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 489, in load_entry_point return get_distribution(dist).load_entry_point(group, name) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2852, in load_entry_point return ep.load() File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2443, in load return self.resolve() File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 2449, in resolve module = __import__(self.module_name, fromlist=['__name__'], level=0) File "/home/ajinkya/Music/streamlit/lib/streamlit/__init__.py", line 96, in <module> from streamlit.DeltaGenerator import DeltaGenerator as _DeltaGenerator File "/home/ajinkya/Music/streamlit/lib/streamlit/DeltaGenerator.py", line 35, in <module> from streamlit.proto import Balloons_pb2 ImportError: cannot import name Balloons_pb2 </denchmark-code>
I am using ubuntu 16

I've encounter the same problem and solved by a clean install From <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing>https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/wiki/Contributing</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>$ cd frontend $ yarn start </denchmark-code>
before running streamlit hello

I get : <denchmark-code>(lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit$ (lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit$ cd frontend/ (lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit/frontend$ yarn start /usr/share/yarn/lib/cli.js:46099 let { ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token { at exports.runInThisContext (vm.js:53:16) at Module._compile (module.js:374:25) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:417:10) at Module.load (module.js:344:32) at Function.Module._load (module.js:301:12) at Module.require (module.js:354:17) at require (internal/module.js:12:17) at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/yarn/bin/yarn.js:24:13) at Module._compile (module.js:410:26) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:417:10) </denchmark-code>
Try a clean install
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ajinkya933>@ajinkya933</denchmark-link> , hope the clean install recommendation helped. If not, feel free to let us know.

there is same error after doing clean install, i guess ill wait till the pip install streamlit will have this feature embedded in it
I get : (lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit$ (lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit$ cd frontend/ (lib) ajinkya@ajinkya-H310M-S2:~/Documents/streamlit/frontend$ yarn start /usr/share/yarn/lib/cli.js:46099 let { ^
SyntaxError: Unexpected token { at exports.runInThisContext (vm.js:53:16) at Module._compile (module.js:374:25) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:417:10) at Module.load (module.js:344:32) at Function.Module._load (module.js:301:12) at Module.require (module.js:354:17) at require (internal/module.js:12:17) at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/yarn/bin/yarn.js:24:13) at Module._compile (module.js:410:26) at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:417:10)

Still not sure exactly what the issue is but I'm seeing some error output from your Makefile that I don't get in my own environment. <denchmark-code>Makefile:281: extraneous text after 'endif' directive </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>/bin/sh: 2: [[: not found /bin/sh: 2: 3.6.9: not found </denchmark-code>
Moved this to our Eng Planning board. I have been debugging and finding the very same issues documented above.
streamlit 0.52.1 resolved this issue
